meanings.definition: Obtain (something) by force, threats, or other unfair means.
meanings.sent1: The bully tried to extort my lunch money from me.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was arrested for attempting to extort money from innocent people.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon villain tried to extort candy from the other characters.
meanings.sent4: The greedy landlord tried to extort every last penny from his tenants.
meanings.sent5: The dictator used his power to extort loyalty from the citizens.

meanings.definition: Obtain money or benefits by using force, threats, or other unfair means.
meanings.sent1: The corrupt official tried to extort bribes from businesses.
meanings.sent2: The gang members were known to extort money from local shop owners.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to extort treats from its owner by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The con artist tried to extort personal information from unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent5: The hacker attempted to extort money from the company by threatening to release sensitive data.
